December 22, 1996: Fiction
SILENT HONOR, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $24.95.) The attack on Pearl
Harbor has tragic consequences for Japanese-American families.
AIRFRAME, by Michael Crichton. (Knopf, $26.) A young woman investigates a
near disaster that befell a plane on its way from Hong Kong to Denver.
THE CHRISTMAS BOX, by Richard Paul Evans. (Simon & Schuster, $14.95.)
When a family moves in with a widow, they all learn the significance of Christmas.
EXECUTIVE ORDERS, by Tom Clancy. (Putnam, $27.95.) Vice President Jack
Ryan has problems after the deaths of the President and most of the Cabinet,
Congress, the Joint Chiefs and the Supreme Court.
THE FALLEN MAN, by Tony Hillerman. (HarperCollins, $24.) Two Navajo
policemen investigate the mysterious death of a man atop a sacred mountain.
DESPERATION, by Stephen King. (Viking, $27.95.) Visitors to a small mining
town in Nevada encounter terrifying forces.
THE DEEP END OF THE OCEAN, by Jacquelyn Mitchard. (Viking, $23.95.) The
disappearance of a 3-year-old brings a family anguish and redemption.
THE CHRISTMAS TREE, by Julie Salamon. (Random House, $12.95.) The
lifelong friendship between a nun and a fir tree reaches a happy conclusion at
Rockefeller Center.
THE NOTEBOOK, by Nicholas Sparks. (Warner, $16.95.) A World War II veteran
meets an old flame who is about to be married.
MY GAL SUNDAY, by Mary Higgins Clark. (Simon & Schuster, $23.) An ex-
President and his Congresswoman wife investigate four crimes in the capital.
THE THIRD TWIN, by Ken Follett. (Crown, $25.95.) A research scientist's study of
genetic components brings her frightening experiences and romance.
THE LAWS OF OUR FATHERS, by Scott Turow. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux,
$26.95.) The trial of a probation officer for his mother's murder recalls the turbulent
"M" IS FOR MALICE, by Sue Grafton. (Wood/Holt, $25.) Murder results when
sons in line to inherit a family fortune seek their long-missing black sheep brother.
THIS YEAR IT WILL BE DIFFERENT, by Maeve Binchy. (Delacorte, $15.95.)
Fifteen stories about the life of contemporary families at Christmastime.
THE REGULATORS, by Richard Bachman. (Dutton, $24.95.) Killings and other
horrors disrupt a quiet suburban town in Ohio.
December 22, 1996
Non-Fiction
MY SERGEI, by Ekaterina Gordeeva with E. M. Swift. (Warner, $18.95.) A memoir
of the Russian ice skater Sergei Grinkov, who died last year, by his longtime
partner and wife.
A REPORTER'S LIFE, by Walter Cronkite. (Knopf, $26.95.) From Kansas City
newsboy to newspaper reporter to television anchorman: a memoir.
FOREVER, ERMA, by Erma Bombeck. (Andrews & McMeel, $22.95.) More than
190 pieces written over 31 years by the syndicated columnist, who died this year.
DOGBERT'S TOP SECRET MANAGEMENT HANDBOOK, by Scott Adams.
(Harper Business, $16.) A satirical look, in words and cartoons, at the current
foibles of business and management.
ANGELA'S ASHES, by Frank McCourt. (Scribner, $24.) An Irish-American writer
recalls his childhood amid the miseries of Limerick.
THE DILBERT PRINCIPLE, by Scott Adams. (Harper Business, $22.) More
observations on the foibles of the business world, reported in words and cartoons.
EVERYONE IS ENTITLED TO MY OPINION, by David Brinkley. (Knopf, $20.)
Commentaries on events during the past 15 years by the television newscaster.
DOWN IN THE GARDEN, by Anne Geddes. (Cedco, $49.95.) A collection of
photographs of infants dressed up as flora and fauna, with brief comments.
THE SOUL'S CODE, by James Hillman. (Random House, $23.) A psychologist
analyzes the elements that make up each person's essence.
I'M NOT REALLY HERE, by Tim Allen. (Hyperion, $21.95.) Observations on the
irritations and delights of middle-aged men by the star of "Home Improvement."
SLOUCHING TOWARDS GOMORRAH, by Robert H. Bork. (Regan Books/
HarperCollins, $25.) An indictment of modern liberalism by the former judge.
MY STORY, by Sarah, the Duchess of York, with Jeff Coplon. (Simon & Schuster,
$24.) The autobiography of the former member of the British royal family.
LIVING FAITH, by Jimmy Carter. (Times Books/Random House, $23.) The former
President looks back at his life through the lens of his religious beliefs.
JAMES HERRIOT'S FAVORITE DOG STORIES, by James Herriot. (St. Martin's,
$17.95.) Ten tales recounted by the Yorkshire veterinarian, who died last year.
UNDAUNTED COURAGE, by Stephen E. Ambrose. (Simon & Schuster, $27.50.)
The story of how Thomas Jefferson sponsored Lewis and Clark's exploration.
